sen.j: 平安時代（へいあんじだい、794年-1185年頃）とは、794年に桓武天皇が平安京（京都）に都（首都）を移してから、鎌倉幕府の成立までの約390年間を指す日本の歴史の時代区分の一つ。
sen.e: the Heian period is a period of Japanese history of about 390 years, running from 794 when emperor Kanmu moved its capital to Heian Kyo (ancient Kyoto) to the establishment of the Kamakura Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

The Heian period denotes a period of Japanese history spanning roughly 390 years, from 794 when Emperor Kanmu moved the capital to Heian Kyo (ancient Kyoto) to the establishment of the Kamakura Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 京都市におかれた平安京が、鎌倉幕府が成立するまで政治上の唯一の中心だったことから平安時代と称する。
sen.e: the period is named after the fact that Heian-Kyo in Kyoto City was the only political center before the establishment of the Kamakura Bakufu.

sen.j: 平安前期は、前代（奈良時代）からの中央集権的な律令制を、部分的な修正を加えながらも、基本的には継承していった。
sen.e: In the early Heian period, the Ritsuryo system of centralized governance structure from the former period (the Nara period) was basically continued with partial amendments.

sen.j: しかし、律令制と現実の乖離が大きくなっていき、9世紀末～10世紀初頭ごろ、政府は税収を確保するため、律令制の基本だった人別支配体制を改め、土地を対象に課税する支配体制へと大きく方針転換した。
sen.e: However, as the the Ritsuryo system lost touch with the realities, the government changed its policy from the individual-based ruling system, which was the base of the the Ritsuryo system to a land-based ruling system in order to secure tax revenue from the end of the 9th century to the beginning of the 10th century.

sen.j: この方針転換は、民間の有力者に権限を委譲してこれを現地赴任の筆頭国司（受領）が統括することにより新たな支配体制を構築するものであり、これを王朝国家体制という。
sen.e: this change was conducted to establish the new ruling system by delegating some power to local influential people under the control of the head of the provincial governors (the head of Kokushi, Zuryo), who were dispatched there, and the system is called the dynasty state system.

sen.j: 王朝国家体制期は、通常古代の末期に位置づけられるが、分権的な中世の萌芽期と位置づけることも可能であり、古代から中世への過渡期と理解されている（日本文学史研究においては「中古」という表現も用いられている）。
sen.e: Although the dynasty system is usually placed at the end of the ancient times, it can be placed in groundbreaking years and interpreted as a transient period. (In the historical study of Japanese literature, the expression of 'Heian era' is used.)

sen.j: 王朝国家体制の下では、国家から土地経営や人民支配の権限を委譲された有力百姓（田堵・名主）層の成長が見られた。
sen.e: Under this system, influential farmers, (Tato: farm managers who lease public fields from provincial lords and produce agricultural products; and Myoshu: owners of rice fields) to whom the power of managing land and controlling people was transmitted from the government, became powerful.

sen.j: 国家権限の委譲とこれによる中央集権の過大な負担の軽減により、中央政界では政治が安定し、官職が特定の家業を担う家系に世襲される家職化が進み、貴族の最上位では摂関家が確立し、中流貴族に固定した階層は中央においては家業の専門技能によって公務を担う技能官人として行政実務を、地方においては受領となって地方行政を担った（平安貴族）。
sen.e: the transmission of governmental power and authority reduced the burden of the government, which enabled political stabilization in the central government, and facilitated heredity transfer of government posts: among the aristocracy, the highest became regents and advisers, the middle-class carried out administrative affairs based on the specialized skills related with their family businesses in the central government and carried out administration as Zuryo in the local regions (Nobles in the the Heian period).

sen.j: こうした中で最初の武家政権である平氏政権が登場するが、この時期の社会矛盾を一手に引き受けたため、程なくして同時多発的に全国に拡大した内乱により崩壊してしまう。
sen.e: As the first Samurai government, the Taira clan administration came to the forefront, but soon collapsed due to simultaneously-occurring, nation-wide civil wars since they shouldered the social contradiction of that time all by themselves.

sen.j: 平氏政権の崩壊とともに、中央政府である朝廷とは別個に、内乱を収拾して東国の支配権を得た鎌倉幕府が登場し、平安時代は幕を下ろした。
sen.e: With the collapse of the Taira clan administration, the Kamakura bakufu came to power after sorting out the civil wars and gaining the right to rule the Eastern provinces, leading to the end of the Heian period.

sen.j: 奈良末期の宝亀元年（770年）の称徳天皇が崩御し、天智天皇系の光仁天皇が60前後という高齢ながらに即位した。
sen.e: In 770, at the end of the Nara period, Emperor Shotoku passed away and Emperor Konin, a descendent of Emperor Tenchi, ascended the throne although he was already around 60 years old.

sen.e: His reformations were intended to reorganize the Ritsuryo system and as a part of the reformations, he forcibly relocated the capital from Heijo kyo (ancient Nara) to Nagaoka kyo and then from Nagaoka kyo to Heian kyo (in 794).

sen.j: 平城は弟の嵯峨天皇に譲位した後も執政権を掌握し続けようとしたが、それを嫌った嵯峨との間に対立が深まり、最終的には軍事衝突により嵯峨側が勝利した（810年、薬子の変）。
sen.e: Although Emperor Heizei tried to keep the ruling power after abdicating the throne to his brother, Emperor Saga, the latter did not welcome it, which led to a serious conflict between them, and finally to a military confrontation, in which Emperor Saga won Kusuko no hen (Kusuko Incident) in 810).

sen.j: この事件以降、12世紀中葉の平治の乱まで中央の政治抗争は武力を伴わず、死刑も執行されない非武力的な政治の時代が永らく続くこととなった。
sen.e: After that incident, until Heiji no ran (Heiji Rebellion), the non-violent political age continued, during which central political conflicts didn't lead to military confrontations or the carrying out of the death penalty.

sen.j: 嵯峨治世初期は、太政官筆頭だった藤原園人の主導のもと、百姓撫民（貧民救済）そして権門（有力貴族・寺社）抑制の政策がとられた。
sen.e: At the beginning of the reign of Emperor Saga, FUJIWARA no Sonohito, the head council of state, lead the policy to rescue farmers (relief of the poor) and control power (influential aristocracy, temples and shrine).

sen.e: this policy was based on Confucianism, the background idea of the Ritsuryo system but FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu changed the policy drastically, making facilitation of reclaimed land development the policy line.

sen.j: こうした仏教の影響を日本古来の信仰も受けて、本地垂迹説があらわれて神仏習合が進んでいった。
sen.e: Japanese traditional religion was influenced by Buddhism, Han-honji-suijaku setsu (theory of original reality and manifested traces) was introduced, leading to Syncretism of Shinto and Buddhism.

sen.j: 嵯峨天皇から清和天皇にかけての時期は、凌雲集などの漢文詩集が編纂されたり、唐風の書がはやるなど、唐風文化が花開いた。
sen.e: From Emperor Saga to Emperor Seiwa, Tang-way culture was in full bloom; poetry books of Chinese classics, including Ryounshu (Cloud-borne collection), were compiled and Tang-way calligraphy was popular.

sen.j: この唐風が非常に強い文化を弘仁・貞観文化という。
sen.e: the culture with a strong influence from Tang is called Konin-Jogan Culture.
The culture which was strongly influenced by the Tang dynasty is called Konin-Jogan Culture.

sen.j: 文化の国風化（日本化）の萌芽は、奈良時代から見られていたが、平安初期は唐風文化の影に隠れるかのようになっていた。
sen.e: Although beginnings of Kokufubunka (Japanized culture: aristocratic culture) were seen in the Nara period, it was hidden under the shadow of Tang-way culture.

Although the beginnings of Kokufu Bunka (Japan's original national culture) were seen in the Nara period, it was hidden under the shadow of Tang-way culture.
sen.cmt: 「文化の国風化」を「国風文化」としていますので、215で出てくる国風文化の定訳をここで記入します。

sen.j: しかし、唐風化の波が沈静化すると、ふたたび日本的な要素が文化の前面へと現れてきた。
sen.e: When the influence of Tang weakened, factors with Japanese characteristics became apparent.
When the influence of the Tang dynasty weakened, factors which were uniquely Japanese became apparent.

sen.j: これが、平安中期ごろの国風文化である。
sen.e: this is the Kokufubunka (aristocratic culture) in the mid- Heian period.

sen.j: 特徴としては、平仮名・片仮名の発明で中古日本語の表記が容易になったことによる、和歌・日記・物語文学の隆盛、官衣束帯の登場（官服の国風化）、寝殿造の登場などがある。
sen.e: It is characterized by the following: the prosperity of waka, diaries, chronicles, which occurred because description of ancient and medieval Japanese became easier following the invention of Hiragana and Katakana; the appearance of Kan-i-sokutai (official uniform in aristocratic culture), and the appearance of Shinden-zukuri style (the palace style of the Fujiwara period architecture).

It is characterized by the following: the prosperity of waka, diaries, chronicles, which occurred because description of ancient and medieval Japanese became easier following the invention of Hiragana and Katakana; the appearance of Kan-i-sokutai (official uniform in aristocratic culture), and the appearance of Shinden-zukuri style (the palace style of Fujiwara period architecture).

It is characterized by the following: the prosperity of waka, diaries, chronicles, which occurred because description of ancient and medieval Japanese became easier following the invention of hiragana (Japanese syllabary characters) and katakana (one of the Japanese syllabaries); the appearance of Kan-i-sokutai (official uniform in aristocratic culture), and the appearance of Shinden-zukuri style (architecture representative [characteristic] of a nobleman's residence in the Heian period).
sen.cmt: 平仮名の定訳と片仮名の説明補足寝殿造を登録の多い説明に変更しました。

sen.j: また、平安中期は、仏教の末法思想が人々に広く浸透し、浄土思想・浄土教が盛んとなった。
sen.e: In the mid- Heian period, Mappo-shiso, the "Pessimism due to decadent-age theory" belief was prevalent, and Pure Land Buddhism, Jodo (Pure Land) sect was widely accepted.

sen.j: 民衆に仏教信仰が拡がったのもこの時期であり、空也や融通念仏の良忍などの僧が民衆の中で活躍した。
sen.e: It was during that time that Buddhism was widely accepted among ordinary people and Kuya as well as Ryonin of Yuzu nenbutsu (reciting the name of Amida Buddha) was active among them.

sen.j: 平安末期になると歴史物語・軍記物語などの時代を顧みる文学が芽生えた。
sen.e: At the end of the Heian period, literature that looked back over the past, such as historical tales and war chronicles, was born.

sen.j: 天台仏教・山岳仏教が日本各地へ広がり、豊後国東半島（豊貴寺大堂など）や北陸地方（平泉寺など）などで動きが顕著であった。
sen.e: Tendai Buddhism and Mountain Buddhism spread all over Japan and the regions where this was prominent was Kunisaki peninsula in the Fungo Province (including Main Hall in Fuki-ji Temple) and Hokuriku District (including Heisen-ji Temple).

sen.j: 当時、民衆の間に今様という歌謡が流行し、後白河上皇により今様を集成した『梁塵秘抄』が編まれた。
sen.e: the songs and ballads called imayo were popular among ordinary people and "Ryojinhi-sho" (folk song collection, which literarly means "Songs to Make the Dust Dance on the Beams") was compiled under the order of retired Emperor Goshirakawa.

sen.j: 覚猷（鳥羽僧正）筆と伝えられ、人々の様子をユーモラスかつ活き活きとした姿で描いた鳥獣人物戯画もこの時代の作品である。
sen.e: Choju-Jinbutsu-Giga Emaki (Scrolles of frolicking Animals) was drawn in that period which is said to have been drawn by Kakuya (Toba Sojo (high Buddhist priest) and it shows vivid and humorous pictures of people.
